Class naval.Naval 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.awt.Component
           |
           +----java.awt.Canvas
                   |
                   +----sea.Sea
                           |
                           +----naval.Naval
public class Naval
extends Sea
implements WorriedSea
Naval is the main class in Naval Warefare. This class keeps track of navys at war. Maybe this class should be named OnePlayerBattle or something like that, since there seems to be some one-player-designs in this class.

app
bombed_hit
A vector of sea.Coord's where the player have hit the enemy.
bombed_miss
A vector of sea.Coord's where the player have made holes in the sea.
current_held_pos
enemy
The navy played by the computer.
enemy_bg
The enemys background (where the user drops bombs) is filled whith this color to make it differ.

In this class, to touch a pos means nothing, but in subclasses...
Overrides:
mouseDown in class Sea
mouseUp 
  public void mouseUp(Coord pos,
                      Event evt)
The user touched the sea. Depending of the state_of_game this means (s)he either places a ship or drops a bomb. In the later case the enemy drops a bomb as well.
Overrides:
mouseUp in class Sea
placeBomb 
  public boolean placeBomb(String who,
                           Coord pos,
                           Navy aim)
This is the method that actually detonates the bomb.
Parameters:
who - - the one who is firing
pos - - where the shot hit
aim - - the navy it was aimed at
Returns:
true if the bomb hits the aim.
legalMove 
  public boolean legalMove(Navy navy,
                           Coord pos)
Check if a move is legal
Parameters:
navy - The navy that wants to make the move.
pos - The coordinate where navy wants to drop a bomb.
Returns:
True if the move is legal, false otherwise.
getOpponent 
  public Navy getOpponent(Navy navy)
Returns:
The opponent to navy.
getBombedHits 
  public Vector getBombedHits()
Returns:
a copy of the vector of bombs that did hit something.
getBombedMisses 
  public Vector getBombedMisses()
Returns:
a copy of the vector of bombs that did not hit something.
